that's good... your swap shouldn't be getting used. if it is, then you need more RAM...  what you're seeing is cached RAM...
it's okay... you just don't understand how Linux uses RAM yet...  you are fine.

example:  You run firefox...  then close it...  it doesn't clear firefox from the RAM, it keeps it cahced so if you use it again.. it's already there... thus improving load time...  however; if that space is needed because you are using other apps, it will readily use that space without thinking.
